item.title: Penetrating the World of Android: MacBook M1
item.description: If you have got yourself a Mac to get better at hacking (of course ethically), then you might have already tried setting up an android penetration testing environment in your laptop. Definitely, I agree that this is a tough nut to crack. You might have faced several issues, whether it’s about installing Genymotion or about SSL Pinning bypass. Don’t worry, we will cover all the steps to create a setup from scratch.

About Hello ðŸ‘‹ Iâ€™m Mahesh. I live in Bangalore, Karnataka. Iâ€™m a Product Security Engineer at Amazon. I completed my studies in Computer Science and Engineering at JECRC University in Jaipur, Rajasthan. Previously, I worked at Jupiter, one of the top neobanks in India, and at Acko, India’s leading insur-tech company, primarily focusing on cloud and product security. Note: Views and opinions expressed on this blog are my own and do not represent my employer.

Certificates Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Security Engineer EC-Council - Certified Ethical Hacker v11 AWS Cloud Quest: Cloud Practitioner Google Workspace Security Microsoft Certified: Security Engineer Associate Microsoft Certified: Identity & Access Management Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate Microsoft 365 Certified: Security Administrator Microsoft Certified: Security Operations Analyst Associate Microsoft Certified: Security, Compliance, Identity Fundamentals CCNP: Core Networking CCNA v7: Introduction to Networks Cisco CyberOps Associate Cisco Cybersecurity Essentials Splunk Infrastructure Overview Splunk User Behaviour Analytics Splunk Fundamentals
